AssociateHostedZone.name: AssociateHostedZone
AssociateHostedZone.documentation: Associates a Route 53 private hosted zone with a Route 53 Global Resolver resource. This allows the resolver to resolve DNS queries for the private hosted zone from anywhere globally.

BatchCreateFirewallRule.name: BatchCreateFirewallRule
BatchCreateFirewallRule.documentation: Creates multiple DNS firewall rules in a single operation. This is more efficient than creating rules individually when you need to set up multiple rules at once.

BatchDeleteFirewallRule.name: BatchDeleteFirewallRule
BatchDeleteFirewallRule.documentation: Deletes multiple DNS firewall rules in a single operation. This is more efficient than deleting rules individually.

BatchUpdateFirewallRule.name: BatchUpdateFirewallRule
BatchUpdateFirewallRule.documentation: Updates multiple DNS firewall rules in a single operation. This is more efficient than updating rules individually.

CreateAccessSource.name: CreateAccessSource
CreateAccessSource.documentation: Creates an access source for a DNS view. Access sources define IP addresses or CIDR ranges that are allowed to send DNS queries to the Route 53 Global Resolver, along with the permitted DNS protocols.

CreateAccessToken.name: CreateAccessToken
CreateAccessToken.documentation: Creates an access token for a DNS view. Access tokens provide token-based authentication for DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) and DNS-over-TLS (DoT) connections to the Route 53 Global Resolver.

CreateDNSView.name: CreateDNSView
CreateDNSView.documentation: Creates a DNS view within a Route 53 Global Resolver. A DNS view models end users, user groups, networks, and devices, and serves as a parent resource that holds configurations controlling access, authorization, DNS firewall rules, and forwarding rules.

CreateFirewallDomainList.name: CreateFirewallDomainList
CreateFirewallDomainList.documentation: Creates a firewall domain list. Domain lists are reusable sets of domain specifications that you use in DNS firewall rules to allow, block, or alert on DNS queries to specific domains.

CreateFirewallRule.name: CreateFirewallRule
CreateFirewallRule.documentation: Creates a DNS firewall rule. Firewall rules define actions (ALLOW, BLOCK, or ALERT) to take on DNS queries that match specified domain lists, managed domain lists, or advanced threat protections.

CreateGlobalResolver.name: CreateGlobalResolver
CreateGlobalResolver.documentation: Creates a new Route 53 Global Resolver instance. A Route 53 Global Resolver is a global, internet-accessible DNS resolver that provides secure DNS resolution for both public and private domains through global anycast IP addresses.

DeleteAccessSource.name: DeleteAccessSource
DeleteAccessSource.documentation: Deletes an access source. This operation cannot be undone.

DeleteAccessToken.name: DeleteAccessToken
DeleteAccessToken.documentation: Deletes an access token. This operation cannot be undone.

DeleteDNSView.name: DeleteDNSView
DeleteDNSView.documentation: Deletes a DNS view. This operation cannot be undone.

DeleteFirewallDomainList.name: DeleteFirewallDomainList
DeleteFirewallDomainList.documentation: Deletes a firewall domain list. This operation cannot be undone.

DeleteFirewallRule.name: DeleteFirewallRule
DeleteFirewallRule.documentation: Deletes a DNS firewall rule. This operation cannot be undone.

DeleteGlobalResolver.name: DeleteGlobalResolver
DeleteGlobalResolver.documentation: Deletes a Route 53 Global Resolver instance. This operation cannot be undone. All associated DNS views, access sources, tokens, and firewall rules are also deleted.

DisableDNSView.name: DisableDNSView
DisableDNSView.documentation: Disables a DNS view, preventing it from serving DNS queries.

DisassociateHostedZone.name: DisassociateHostedZone
DisassociateHostedZone.documentation: Disassociates a Route 53 private hosted zone from a Route 53 Global Resolver resource.

EnableDNSView.name: EnableDNSView
EnableDNSView.documentation: Enables a disabled DNS view, allowing it to serve DNS queries again.

GetFirewallDomainList.name: GetFirewallDomainList
GetFirewallDomainList.documentation: Retrieves information about a firewall domain list.

GetFirewallRule.name: GetFirewallRule
GetFirewallRule.documentation: Retrieves information about a DNS firewall rule.

GetGlobalResolver.name: GetGlobalResolver
GetGlobalResolver.documentation: Retrieves information about a Route 53 Global Resolver instance.

GetHostedZoneAssociation.name: GetHostedZoneAssociation
GetHostedZoneAssociation.documentation: Retrieves information about a hosted zone association.

GetManagedFirewallDomainList.name: GetManagedFirewallDomainList
GetManagedFirewallDomainList.documentation: Retrieves information about an AWS-managed firewall domain list. Managed domain lists contain domains associated with malicious activity, content categories, or specific threats.

ImportFirewallDomains.name: ImportFirewallDomains
ImportFirewallDomains.documentation: Imports a list of domains from an Amazon S3 file into a firewall domain list. The file should contain one domain per line.

ListAccessSources.name: ListAccessSources
ListAccessSources.documentation: Lists all access sources with pagination support.

ListAccessTokens.name: ListAccessTokens
ListAccessTokens.documentation: Lists all access tokens for a DNS view with pagination support.

ListDNSViews.name: ListDNSViews
ListDNSViews.documentation: Lists all DNS views for a Route 53 Global Resolver with pagination support.

ListFirewallDomainLists.name: ListFirewallDomainLists
ListFirewallDomainLists.documentation: Lists all firewall domain lists for a Route 53 Global Resolver with pagination support.

ListFirewallDomains.name: ListFirewallDomains
ListFirewallDomains.documentation: Lists all the domains in DNS Firewall domain list you have created.

ListFirewallRules.name: ListFirewallRules
ListFirewallRules.documentation: Lists all DNS firewall rules for a DNS view with pagination support.

ListGlobalResolvers.name: ListGlobalResolvers
ListGlobalResolvers.documentation: Lists all Route 53 Global Resolver instances in your account with pagination support.

ListHostedZoneAssociations.name: ListHostedZoneAssociations
ListHostedZoneAssociations.documentation: Lists all hosted zone associations for a Route 53 Global Resolver resource with pagination support.

ListManagedFirewallDomainLists.name: ListManagedFirewallDomainLists
ListManagedFirewallDomainLists.documentation: Returns a paginated list of the AWS Managed DNS Lists and the categories for DNS Firewall. The categories are either THREAT or CONTENT.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags associated with a Route 53 Global Resolver resource.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds or updates tags for a Route 53 Global Resolver resource. Tags are key-value pairs that help you organize and identify your resources.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes tags from a Route 53 Global Resolver resource.

UpdateAccessSource.name: UpdateAccessSource
UpdateAccessSource.documentation: Updates the configuration of an access source.

UpdateAccessToken.name: UpdateAccessToken
UpdateAccessToken.documentation: Updates the configuration of an access token.

UpdateDNSView.name: UpdateDNSView
UpdateDNSView.documentation: Updates the configuration of a DNS view.

UpdateFirewallDomains.name: UpdateFirewallDomains
UpdateFirewallDomains.documentation: Updates a DNS Firewall domain list from an array of specified domains.

UpdateFirewallRule.name: UpdateFirewallRule
UpdateFirewallRule.documentation: Updates the configuration of a DNS firewall rule.

UpdateGlobalResolver.name: UpdateGlobalResolver
UpdateGlobalResolver.documentation: Updates the configuration of a Route 53 Global Resolver instance. You can modify the name, description, and observability region.

UpdateHostedZoneAssociation.name: UpdateHostedZoneAssociation
UpdateHostedZoneAssociation.documentation: Updates the configuration of a hosted zone association.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You don't have permission to perform this operation. Check your IAM permissions and try again.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access source.

cidr.documentation: The CIDR block that defines the IP address range for the access source.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the access source was created.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the access source.

ipAddressType.documentation: The IP address type of the access source.

name.documentation: The name of the access source.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view that the access source is associated with.

protocol.documentation: The protocol used by the access source.

status.documentation: The current status of the access source.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the access source was last updated.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the token.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the token.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the token was created.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view associated with the token.

expiresAt.documentation: The date and time when the token expires.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the global resolver associated with the token.

name.documentation: The name of the token.

status.documentation: The current status of the token.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the token was last updated.

hostedZoneId.documentation: The ID of the Route 53 private hosted zone to associate with the Route 53 Global Resolver resource.

resourceArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Route 53 Global Resolver the private hosted zone will be associated to.

name.documentation: Name for the private hosted zone association.

id.documentation: ID of the association.

resourceArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Route 53 Global Resolver the private hosted zone is associated to.

hostedZoneName.documentation: Name of the hosted zone (also the domain associated with the hosted zone).

name.documentation: Name for the private hosted zone association.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time the private hosted zone association was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time the private hosted zone association was modified.

status.documentation: Aggregate status for all the AWS Regions in which the Route 53 Global Resolver exists.

firewallRules.documentation: The BatchCreateFirewallRuleInputItem objects contain the information for each Firewall rule.

action.documentation: The action to take when a DNS query matches the firewall rule.

blockOverrideDnsType.documentation: The DNS record type for the custom response when the action is BLOCK.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation: The custom domain name for the BLOCK response.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The TTL value for the custom response when the action is BLOCK.

blockResponse.documentation: The type of block response to return when the action is BLOCK.

clientToken.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold for advanced threat detection.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether to enable advanced DNS threat protection for the firewall rule.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The ID of the firewall domain list to associate with the rule.

name.documentation: A name for the firewall rule.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view to associate the firewall rule with.

qType.documentation: The DNS query type that the firewall rule should match.

BatchCreateFirewallRuleInputItem.documentation: Information about a DNS Firewall rule to create in a batch operation.

failures.documentation: High level information about the DNS Firewall rules that failed to create.

successes.documentation: High level information about the DNS Firewall rules that were created.

firewallRule.documentation: The firewall rule that was created in the batch operation.

code.documentation: The HTTP response code for the batch operation result.

message.documentation: A message describing the result of the batch operation, including error details if applicable.

BatchCreateFirewallRuleOutputItem.documentation: Information about the result of creating a DNS Firewall rule in a batch operation.

action.documentation: The action configured for the created firewall rule.

blockOverrideDnsType.documentation: The DNS record type configured for the created firewall rule's custom response.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation: The custom domain name configured for the created firewall rule's BLOCK response.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The TTL value configured for the created firewall rule's custom response.

blockResponse.documentation: The type of block response configured for the created firewall rule.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identified the request and ensured idempotency.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold configured for the created firewall rule's advanced threat detection.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was created.

description.documentation: The description of the created firewall rule.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether advanced DNS threat protection is enabled for the created firewall rule.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The ID of the firewall domain list associated with the created firewall rule.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the created firewall rule.

managedDomainListName.documentation: The name of the managed domain list associated with the created firewall rule.

name.documentation: The name of the created firewall rule.

priority.documentation: The priority of the created firewall rule.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view associated with the created firewall rule.

queryType.documentation: The DNS query type that the created firewall rule matches.

status.documentation: The current status of the created firewall rule.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was last updated.

BatchCreateFirewallRuleResult.documentation: The result of creating a firewall rule in a batch operation.

firewallRules.documentation: An array of the DNS Firewall IDs to be deleted.

firewallRuleId.documentation: The ID of the DNS Firewall rule to delete.

successes.documentation: High level information about the DNS Firewall rules that were deleted successfully.

firewallRule.documentation: The firewall rule that was deleted in the batch operation.

code.documentation: The response code for the delete operation.

message.documentation: The response message for the delete operation.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation: The custom domain name for the BLOCK response.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The TTL value for the custom response when the action is BLOCK.

blockResponse.documentation: The type of block response to return when the action is BLOCK.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold for advanced threat detection.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether to enable advanced DNS threat protection for the firewall rule.

firewallRuleId.documentation: The unique identifier of the firewall rule to update.

name.documentation: A name for the firewall rule.

BatchUpdateFirewallRuleInputItem.documentation: Information for updating a firewall rule in a batch operation.

failures.documentation: High level information about the DNS Firewall rules that failed to update.

successes.documentation: High level information about the DNS Firewall rules that were successfully updated.

firewallRule.documentation: The firewall rule that was updated in the batch operation.

code.documentation: The response code for the update operation.

message.documentation: The response message for the update operation.

BatchUpdateFirewallRuleOutputItem.documentation: The result of updating a firewall rule in a batch operation.

action.documentation: The action configured for the updated firewall rule.

blockOverrideDnsType.documentation: The DNS record type configured for the updated firewall rule's custom response.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation: The custom domain name configured for the updated firewall rule's BLOCK response.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The TTL value configured for the updated firewall rule's custom response.

blockResponse.documentation: The type of block response configured for the updated firewall rule.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identified the request and ensured idempotency.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold configured for the updated firewall rule's advanced threat detection.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was originally created.

description.documentation: The description of the updated firewall rule.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether advanced DNS threat protection is enabled for the updated firewall rule.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The ID of the firewall domain list associated with the updated firewall rule.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the updated firewall rule.

name.documentation: The name of the updated firewall rule.

priority.documentation: The priority of the updated firewall rule.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view associated with the updated firewall rule.

queryType.documentation: The DNS query type that the updated firewall rule matches.

status.documentation: The current status of the updated firewall rule.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was last updated.

BatchUpdateFirewallRuleResult.documentation: Information about a firewall rule that was updated in a batch operation.

ConflictException.documentation: The request conflicts with the current state of the resource. This can occur when trying to modify a resource that is not in a valid state for the requested operation.

cidr.documentation: The IP address or CIDR range that is allowed to send DNS queries to the Route 53 Global Resolver.

clientToken.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

ipAddressType.documentation: The IP address type for this access source. Valid values are IPv4 and IPv6 (if the Route 53 Global Resolver supports dual-stack).

name.documentation: A descriptive name for the access source.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view to associate with this access source.

protocol.documentation: The DNS protocol that is permitted for this access source. Valid values are Do53 (DNS over port 53), DoT (DNS over TLS), and DoH (DNS over HTTPS).

tags.documentation: Tags to associate with the access source.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access source.

cidr.documentation: The IP address or CIDR range that is allowed to send DNS queries to the Route 53 Global Resolver.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the access source was created.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the access source.

ipAddressType.documentation: The IP address type for this access source (IPv4 or IPv6).

name.documentation: The descriptive name of the access source.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view associated with this access source.

protocol.documentation: The DNS protocol that is permitted for this access source (Do53, DoT, or DoH).

status.documentation: The operational status of the access source.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the access source was last updated.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency. This means that making the same request multiple times with the same clientToken has the same result every time.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view to associate with this token.

expiresAt.documentation: The date and time when the token expires. Tokens can have a minimum expiration of 30 days and maximum of 365 days from creation.

name.documentation: A descriptive name for the access token.

tags.documentation: An array of user-defined keys and optional values. These tags can be used for categorization and organization.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the access token.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access token.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the access token was created.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view associated with this access token.

expiresAt.documentation: The date and time when the access token expires.

name.documentation: The name of the access token.

status.documentation: The operational status of the access token.

value.documentation: The access token value. This token should be included in DoH and DoT requests for authentication. Keep this value secure as it provides access to your Route 53 Global Resolver.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the Route 53 Global Resolver to associate with this DNS view.

clientToken.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

name.documentation: A descriptive name for the DNS view.

dnssecValidation.documentation: Whether to enable DNSSEC validation for DNS queries in this DNS view. When enabled, the resolver verifies the authenticity and integrity of DNS responses from public name servers for DNSSEC-signed domains.

ednsClientSubnet.documentation: Whether to enable EDNS Client Subnet injection for DNS queries in this DNS view. When enabled, client subnet information is forwarded to provide more accurate geographic-based DNS responses.

firewallRulesFailOpen.documentation: Determines the behavior when Route 53 Global Resolver cannot apply DNS firewall rules due to service impairment. When enabled, DNS queries are allowed through; when disabled, queries are blocked.

description.documentation: An optional description for the DNS view.

tags.documentation: Tags to associate with the DNS view.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the DNS view.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DNS view.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

dnssecValidation.documentation: Whether DNSSEC validation is enabled for DNS queries in this DNS view.

ednsClientSubnet.documentation: Whether EDNS Client Subnet injection is enabled for DNS queries in this DNS view.

firewallRulesFailOpen.documentation: The behavior when Route 53 Global Resolver cannot apply DNS firewall rules due to service impairment.

name.documentation: The descriptive name of the DNS view.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the Route 53 Global Resolver instance the DNS view is created for.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the DNS view was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the DNS view was last updated.

status.documentation: The operational status of the DNS view.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency. This means that making the same request multiple times with the same clientToken has the same result every time.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the Route 53 Global Resolver that the domain list will be associated with.

description.documentation: An optional description for the firewall domain list.

name.documentation: A descriptive name for the firewall domain list.

tags.documentation: An array of user-defined keys and optional values. These tags can be used for categorization and organization.

arn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the domain list.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the Route 53 Global Resolver that the domain list is associated with.

createdAt.documentation: The time and date the domain list was created on.

domainCount.documentation: Number of domains in the domain list.

id.documentation: ID of the domain list.

name.documentation: Name of the domain list.

status.documentation: Creation status of the domain list.

updatedAt.documentation: The time and date the domain list was updated.

action.documentation:
The action that DNS Firewall should take on a DNS query when it matches one of the domains in the rule's domain list:

  • ALLOW - Permit the request to go through.

  • ALERT - Permit the request and send metrics and logs to CloudWatch.

  • BLOCK - Disallow the request. This option requires additional details in the rule's BlockResponse.

blockOverrideDnsType.documentation:
The DNS record's type. This determines the format of the record value that you provided in BlockOverrideDomain. Used for the rule action BLOCK with a BlockResponse setting of OVERRIDE.

This setting is required if the BlockResponse setting is OVERRIDE.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation:
The custom DNS record to send back in response to the query. Used for the rule action BLOCK with a BlockResponse setting of OVERRIDE.

This setting is required if the BlockResponse setting is OVERRIDE.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation:
The recommended amount of time, in seconds, for the DNS resolver or web browser to cache the provided override record. Used for the rule action BLOCK with a BlockResponse setting of OVERRIDE.

This setting is required if the BlockResponse setting is OVERRIDE.

blockResponse.documentation: The response to return when the action is BLOCK. Valid values are NXDOMAIN (domain does not exist), NODATA (domain exists but no records), or OVERRIDE (return custom response).

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency. This means that making the same request multiple times with the same clientToken has the same result every time.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold for advanced threat detection. Valid values are HIGH, MEDIUM, or LOW, indicating the accuracy level required for threat detection.

description.documentation: An optional description for the firewall rule.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether to enable advanced DNS threat protection for this rule. Advanced protection can detect and block DNS tunneling and Domain Generation Algorithm (DGA) threats.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The ID of the firewall domain list to use in this rule.

name.documentation: A descriptive name for the firewall rule.

priority.documentation: The priority of this rule. Rules are evaluated in priority order, with lower numbers having higher priority. When a DNS query matches multiple rules, the rule with the highest priority (lowest number) is applied.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view to associate with this firewall rule.

qType.documentation: The DNS query type to match for this rule. Examples include A (IPv4 address), AAAA (IPv6 address), MX (mail exchange), or TXT (text record).

action.documentation: The action that DNS Firewall takes on DNS queries that match this rule.

blockOverrideDnsType.documentation: The DNS record type for the custom response when blockResponse is OVERRIDE.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation: The custom domain to return when the action is BLOCK and blockResponse is OVERRIDE.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The time-to-live (TTL) value for the custom response when blockResponse is OVERRIDE.

blockResponse.documentation: The response to return when the action is BLOCK.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold for advanced threat detection.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was created.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether advanced DNS threat protection is enabled for this rule.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The ID of the firewall domain list used in this rule.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the firewall rule.

name.documentation: The name of the firewall rule.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view associated with this firewall rule.

queryType.documentation: The DNS query type that this rule matches.

status.documentation: The operational status of the firewall rule.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was last updated.

clientToken.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency. If you make multiple requests with the same client token, only one Route 53 Global Resolver is created.

description.documentation: An optional description for the Route 53 Global Resolver instance. Maximum length of 1024 characters.

name.documentation: A descriptive name for the Route 53 Global Resolver instance. Maximum length of 64 characters.

observabilityRegion.documentation: The AWS region where query resolution logs and metrics will be aggregated and delivered. If not specified, logging is not enabled.

regions.documentation: List of AWS regions where the Route 53 Global Resolver will operate. The resolver will be distributed across these regions to provide global availability and low-latency DNS resolution.

tags.documentation: Tags to associate with the Route 53 Global Resolver. Tags are key-value pairs that help you organize and identify your resources.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the Route 53 Global Resolver.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Route 53 Global Resolver.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the Route 53 Global Resolver was created.

description.documentation: The description of the Route 53 Global Resolver.

dnsName.documentation: The hostname that DNS clients should use for TLS certificate validation when connecting to the Route 53 Global Resolver. This value resolves to the global anycast IP addresses for the resolver.

ipv4Addresses.documentation: The global anycast IPv4 addresses associated with the Route 53 Global Resolver. DNS clients can send queries to these addresses from anywhere on the internet.

name.documentation: The name of the Route 53 Global Resolver.

observabilityRegion.documentation: The AWS Region where observability data for the Route 53 Global Resolver is stored.

regions.documentation: The AWS Regions where the Route 53 Global Resolver is deployed and operational.

status.documentation: The current status of the Route 53 Global Resolver. Possible values are CREATING (being provisioned), UPDATING (being modified), OPERATIONAL (ready to serve queries), or DELETING (being removed).

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the Route 53 Global Resolver was last updated.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the DNS view.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DNS view.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

dnssecValidation.documentation: Whether DNSSEC validation is enabled for the DNS view.

ednsClientSubnet.documentation: Whether EDNS Client Subnet injection is enabled for the DNS view.

firewallRulesFailOpen.documentation: Whether firewall rules fail open when they cannot be evaluated.

name.documentation: The name of the DNS view.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the global resolver that the DNS view is associated with.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the DNS view was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the DNS view was last updated.

status.documentation: The current status of the DNS view.

accessSourceId.documentation: The unique identifier of the access source to delete.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted access source.

cidr.documentation: The IP address or CIDR range of the deleted access source.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the access source was originally created.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the deleted access source.

ipAddressType.documentation: The IP address type of the deleted access source (IPv4 or IPv6).

name.documentation: The name of the deleted access source.

dnsViewId.documentation: The ID of the DNS view that was associated with the deleted access source.

protocol.documentation: The DNS protocol that was permitted for the deleted access source.

status.documentation: The final status of the deleted access source.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the access source was last updated before deletion.

accessTokenId.documentation: The unique identifier of the access token to delete.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the deleted access token.

status.documentation: The final status of the deleted access token.

deletedAt.documentation: The date and time when the access token was deleted.

dnsViewId.documentation: The unique identifier of the DNS view to delete.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the deleted DNS view.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted DNS view.

clientToken.documentation: The unique string that identifies the request and ensures idempotency.

dnssecValidation.documentation: Whether DNSSEC validation was enabled for the deleted DNS view.

ednsClientSubnet.documentation: Whether EDNS Client Subnet injection was enabled for the deleted DNS view.

firewallRulesFailOpen.documentation: The firewall rules fail-open behavior that was configured for the deleted DNS view.

name.documentation: The name of the deleted DNS view.

description.documentation: The description of the deleted DNS view.

globalResolverId.documentation: The ID of the Route 53 Global Resolver that the deleted DNS view was associated with.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the DNS view was originally created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the DNS view was last updated before deletion.

status.documentation: The final status of the deleted DNS view.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The unique identifier of the firewall domain list to delete.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted firewall domain list.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the deleted firewall domain list.

name.documentation: The name of the deleted firewall domain list.

status.documentation: The final status of the deleted firewall domain list.

firewallRuleId.documentation: The unique identifier of the firewall rule to delete.

action.documentation: The action that was configured for the deleted firewall rule.

blockOverrideDnsType.documentation: The DNS record type that was configured for the deleted firewall rule's custom response.

blockOverrideDomain.documentation: The custom domain that was configured for the deleted firewall rule's BLOCK response.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The TTL value that was configured for the deleted firewall rule's custom response.

blockResponse.documentation: The block response type that was configured for the deleted firewall rule.

confidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold that was configured for the deleted firewall rule's advanced threat detection.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time when the firewall rule was originally created.

description.documentation: The description of the deleted firewall rule.

dnsAdvancedProtection.documentation: Whether advanced DNS threat protection was enabled for the deleted firewall rule.

firewallDomainListId.documentation: The ID of the firewall domain list that was associated with the deleted firewall rule.

blockOverrideTtl.documentation: The recommended amount of time, in seconds, for the DNS resolver or web browser to cache the provided override record. Used for the rule action BLOCK with a BlockResponse setting of OVERRIDE.

documentation: Amazon Route 53 Global Resolver is a global, internet-accessible DNS resolver that enables customers to resolve and forward traffic for both public and private domains while ensuring security and authenticity of queries over the internet. Route 53 Global Resolver supports DNS-over-port 53 (Do53), DNS-over-TLS (DoT), and DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) protocols through global anycast IP addresses.
